intro: Ceratocephala falcata subsp. orthoceras, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ceratocephala, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
